alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 9:24PM CDT until May 04 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... South central Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 924 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles east of Morris, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Okmulgee... Haskell... Morris... Schulter... Oktaha... Taft... Boynton... Grayson... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Hoffman... Tullahassee... Bald Hill... Wainwright... Summit... Hitchita... Jamesville... Hectorville... Eram... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
